{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3522636,"name":"","username":"KatilKedi","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f14d63/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-10T20:19:52.854Z","cooked":"

This is my first time programming a robot. I generated swerve code with Phoenix Tuner and then made some settings for our Limelight 2. It can detect apriltags but I want our robot to move when it sees an apriltag and adjust its position accordingly. Can you show me a way on how to do that?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-02-10T20:19:52.854Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":222,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":1134.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":491071,"topic_slug":"apriltag-tracking-with-limelight","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72140,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/apriltag-tracking-with-limelight/491071/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3522651,"name":"Johnathon","username":"Upcoming","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/u/a5b964/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-10T20:40:20.402Z","cooked":"

If you go into limelight documentation you can see how in network tables certain values are recorded from the april tag. These are “tx”, “ty”, “ta”, “id”, and a few others. tx is the x position of the tag within the limelight frame, ty is the y position, id is that id of the tag the limelight is looking at, and ta is how much area the tag takes up in the limelight frame. The way I’ve gone about using these values in the past is creating a pid controller and feeding this pid controller the tx and setting the setpoint to 0. if you put this controller into your drive right you can get it to center with the april tag. That’s the very basic way to do it.

Hi, I am actually using the same set up and got this to work. Heres my Github; the relevant systems are “Vision Subsystem” and “Align Command” important note my limelight is limelight-b, so make sure to rename it if needed!

github.com
